item.title: Melissa Jay
item.description: img { border-radius: 50%; } Thanks for visiting my website! My name is Melissa Jay, and I am a fourth-year PhD Candidate in Biostatistics at the University of Iowa. I am working with Dr. Jacob Oleson on my dissertation research, which focuses on statistical methods for spatio-temporal modeling of cancer risk. We are developing methods for addressing zero inflation in the estimation of age-adjusted rates and methods for performing Bayesian mediation analyses with spatial datasets.

item.title: Publications
item.description: Jay M, Oleson J, Charlton M, Arab A. A Bayesian approach for estimating age-adjusted rates for low-prevalence diseases over space and time. Statistics in Medicine. 2021;40(12):2922-2938. Sewell DK, Penney J, Jay M, Zhang Y, Paulsen JS. Predicting an optimal composite outcome variable for Huntington's disease clinical trials. Journal of Applied Statistics. 2021;48(7):1339-1348. Jay M, Betensky RA. Displaying survival of patient groups defined by covariate paths: Extensions of the Kaplan-Meier estimator.

item.title: Selected Presentations
item.description: Modeling age-adjusted rates from spatio-temporal data sets with excess zero counts. Conference on Statistical Practice. Virtual presentation. 2021. Displaying survival of patient groups defined by covariate paths: Extensions of the Kaplan-Meier estimator. Eastern North American Region International Biometric Society Spring Meeting.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Iowa Summer Institute in Biostatistics The Iowa Summer Institute in Biostatistics (ISIB) is an NIH-funded summer institute focused on introducing undergraduates to the field of biostatistics. While at Iowa, I have been actively involved with ISIB, serving as a Lab Instructor and participating in social activities to acquaint undergraduate scholars with our department and graduate school. Lab Instructor for BIOS:4110 General Biostatistics (Summer 2019, Summer 2021) University of Iowa
